title: Stable Wealth: Get the best of both worlds
summary: Stable Wealth is for investors who want a balanced mix of debt and equity.
description: For people who are optimistic like wealth builders but not so willing to get big on the stock market. With a higher portion set aside for debt fund this portfolio lends much more stability. Basically, you get the best of both worlds.

labels: 76% Debt e.g. Bonds, Real Estate, etc.

title: Wealth Secure: When safety is paramount
summary: Wealth Secure is designed for investors who don’t want to risk their money in stocks.
description: Wealth Secure is designed for investors who don’t want to risk their money in stocks. Some investors just can’t stand the prospect of losing money. Though debt funds are not as volatile as equity schemes it is a misconception that they can’t lose money. Debt funds are sensitive to interest rate movements and will lose money if interest rates go up. That’s why we recommend investing more in short term debt funds as they are less volatile than long-term bonds and focus on earning from interest accruals than on capital gains.

labels: 3% Debt e.g. Bonds, Real Estate, etc.

title: Income Generator: Regular income in the golden years
summary: Income Generator is for retirees looking for a monthly income from their investments.
description: Unlike the other portfolios, the income generator starts with a lumpsum investment and withdraws monthly sum for the investor. It has two medium-term income funds, two short-term debt funds and one debt-oriented hybrid fund. This is a recommended arrangement to bank deposit returns as debt funds yield a slightly better return than fixed deposits. You also have a greater tax advantage since the principal amount is not taxable and the gains are treated as long-term capital gains and taxed at a lower rate. This portfolio is designed to provide retirees a monthly income.
